dithering.description: Dithering reduces the number of colors while preserving visual quality

metadata.title: Image metadata

footer.description: Emu is primarily an experimental project. Its evolution will be guided by its real utility. Contributions are welcome: suggestions, bug reports, or feedback. Thank you for participating in its improvement.

metadataRemoved: Metadata has been automatically removed during processing.

processInfo.title: Applied Processes
processInfo.compression: Compression at {{quality}}% quality ({{ratio}}% reduction, from {{originalSize}} to {{newSize}})

colorPalette.clickToCopy: Click a color to copy its code

ditheringDialogue.title: More information about dithering
ditheringDialogue.description: The processing uses the Floyd-Steinberg dithering algorithm with serpentine mode and preserves the original alpha values of the pixels to maintain transparency.
ditheringDialogue.method: Quantization method (method: 2): Analyzes small areas of the image separately to better preserve local details.
ditheringDialogue.algorithm: Dithering algorithm (dithKern: 'FloydSteinberg'): Creates an illusion of intermediate colors by arranging pixels alternately.
ditheringDialogue.serpentine: Serpentine mode (dithSerp: true): Processes the image in a zigzag instead of always going from left to right.
ditheringDialogue.technicalNote: Technical note: Transparency is preserved by storing the original alpha values in a separate map, then reapplying them after the quantization and dithering process.
